intro: Zantedeschia tropicalis, commonly known as the Calla Lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its striking, arrow-shaped leaves and elegant, white or colored spatulate flowers. The plant belongs to the Araceae family, which is known for its unique inflorescence structure called a spadix, enclosed by a modified leaf called a spathe. Zantedeschia tropicalis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
